metadata.title: USN-6230-1 -- PostgreSQL vulnerability
metadata.description: Alexander Lakhin discovered that PostgreSQL incorrectly handled certain CREATE privileges. An authenticated user could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code as the bootstrap supervisor.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6230-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  postgresql-doc-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm4 postgresql-plperl-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm4 postgresql-server-dev-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm4 postgresql-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm4 postgresql-plpython-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm4 libecpg6 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm4 postgresql-client-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm4 libpq-dev - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm4 postgresql-contrib-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm4 libpgtypes3 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm4 libecpg-dev - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm4 postgresql-pltcl-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm4 libpq5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm4 postgresql-plpython3-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm4 libecpg-compat3 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm4 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
